name: S80/20 share of income
def: Top 20%'s over bottom 20%'s share of the income distribution, ratio

name: Wealth inequality
def: Bottom 40% wealth share, % of total household net wealth

name: Mortality from exposure to outdoor air pollution
Relative poverty rate
def: Poverty rate after taxes and transfers (poverty line at 50% of median disposible income)

name: Gender pay gap
def: Difference between male and female median monthly earnings divided by male median monthly earnings, for full-time employees

name: Business cloud computing access
def: As a percentage of all enterprises using icloud computing

name: Variation in science performance by students' socio-economic status
def: Based on PISA index of economic, social and cultural status

name: Intergenerational earnings elasticity
def: Earnings elasticities for father to son

name: NEET rate
def: Proportion of 15-29 year olds not in employment, education or training services

name: The proportion of adults who are low performers
def: Percentage of adults who score at or below Level 1 in literacy and/or numeracy

name: Share of resilient students
def: A student is classified as resilient if he or she is in the bottom quarter of the PISA index of economic, social and cultural status in the country/economy of assessment and performs in the top quarter of students among all countries/economies, after accounting for socio-economic status

name: Confidence in national government
def: Confidence in national government (2016) and its change since 2007

name: Voter turnout at national election
def: Percentage of votes cast among the population registered to vote. National elections refer to parliamentary elections, with the exceptions of Brazil, Finland, France, Korea, Mexico, the Russian Federation and the United States, where Presidential elections are considered. Australia, Belgium, Brazil, Luxembourg and Turkey enforce compulsory voting. In Chile, compulsory voting was dropped in 2012.

name: Share of women parliamentarians
def: Lower or single house of parliament
